intro: Verbascum obovatum, commonly known as the woolly mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems covered in dense, soft grayish-white hairs. The leaves are large, broad, and gradually taper to a pointed tip, often with a fuzzy texture. It produces yellow flowers in late summer, which are clustered in a cylindrical shape at the top of the stem. This plant is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
